intro: Chorisiva nevadensis, commonly known as the Nevada chorisia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, woolly leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in arid environments. Chorisiva nevadensis is adapted to survive in harsh conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
